message.content: This question requires some basic knowledge about how speed is determined. A cop can tell that a car is speeding because it is cruising quickly. Speed is a measure of how fast an object is moving, so option (A) is the correct answer. Options (B), (C), and (D) are all general observations about a car but do not specifically indicate that it is speeding.

This question requires some basic understanding of the signs and indicators that a police officer may use to determine if a car is speeding. When a car is speeding, it is usually cruising quickly, or traveling at a higher than the designated speed limit. Option (B) is incorrect because driving along can refer to any speed, not necessarily speeding. Option (C) is incorrect because moving forward does not indicate speed. Option (D) is incorrect because being on the road does not necessarily mean that the car is speeding.

Option (D) is true for all cars on the road, regardless of their speed.
